context: Post-race — player lost their first street race on Harbor Road

lines.text: His taillights pull away from you like a bad dream. By the time you hit the overpass, he's already parked, leaning against his hatchback, arms crossed.
Three hundred dollars gone. The crowd — what little there is — barely reacts. Just another nobody who bet more than his car could handle.
You pull up slow. Kill the engine. The silence hits harder than the loss.
He walks over. You're expecting trash talk. That's how it works, right? Winner gets to rub it in.

lines.speaker: Street Racer
lines.text: You showed up. That's more than most people do. Half the guys out here talk about racing and never put a dollar on the line.

choices.text: I'll be back. And I'll be faster.
My car just couldn't keep up.
Three hundred bucks... that was everything.

lines.label: racer_responds_determined
lines.speaker: Street Racer
lines.text: Yeah? Good. That's the right answer. Most people lose once and you never see them again. Come back when you're ready — I'll give you another shot.
There's no mockery in his voice. On these streets, coming back after a loss earns more than a lucky win ever could.

lines.label: racer_responds_blame
lines.speaker: Street Racer
lines.text: Nah, man. Don't do that. A good driver makes a bad car work. That's the whole point out here. Nobody's got a fair ride — you just gotta drive smarter.
He's not being cruel. He's being honest. And honest stings worse.

lines.speaker: Street Racer
lines.text: ...Look. I'm not giving the money back. That's not how this works. But I respect you for being straight about it. Most guys would never admit that.
He reaches into his car and pulls out a business card. Worn edges, oil-stained.

lines.label: post_loss_wrapup
lines.speaker: Street Racer
lines.text: You know Torres Garage? Over on 5th? If you're serious about running these streets, get your ride sorted first. Maya's the real deal. Tell her Rico sent you — or don't. She doesn't care either way.

He climbs back in his car and rolls off. The parking lot empties fast. You're left alone with a lighter wallet and a heavier question: is this city going to eat you alive, or are you going to eat back?
You lost tonight. But you raced. In Nova Pacifica, that's where every story starts.
